intro: Cheilanthes kuhnii, commonly known as the Kuhn's rockcap, is a species of fern that belongs to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to arid and rocky regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. Its rhizomes are thick and fleshy, allowing it to store water and survive in drought conditions. Cheilanthes kuhnii is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in crevices, making it well adapted to harsh, dry environments.
